Package moulton.scalable.texts

Interface HotkeyTextComponent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TextInputComponent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StaticTextBox, TextBox
    public interface HotkeyTextComponent
extends TextInputComponent
    Implementations of HotkeyTextComponent are instances of Clickable that can react to the hotkey commands of "copy", "cut", "paste", and "select all". The MenuManager associated with this component, is in charge of detecting when these hotkey commands are performed by the user, and to call corresponding events. Moreover, the manager will copy the text returned by copy() and cut() to the system clipboard, and will give the contents of the system clipboard (when it can be represented as a string) in the calling of paste(String).
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String copy()
      Called by the MenuManager when it registers a copy request from the user.
      java.lang.String cut()
      Called by the MenuManager when it registers a cut request from the user.
      boolean isHotkeyEnabled()
      Even though a class may have the potential to use hotkeys, there is a layer of flexibility as to whether hotkeys will be operable for specific instances.
      void paste​(java.lang.String pasteText)
      Called by the MenuManager when it registers a paste command from the user.
      void selectAll()
      Called by the MenuManager when it registers a select all command from the user.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        java.lang.String copy()
        Called by the MenuManager when it registers a copy request from the user.
        Returns:
        the text from this component that should be copied to the clipboard

      • cut

        java.lang.String cut()
        Called by the MenuManager when it registers a cut request from the user.
        Returns:
        the text from this component that should be copied to the clipboard

      • paste

        void paste​(java.lang.String pasteText)
        Called by the MenuManager when it registers a paste command from the user.
        Parameters:
        pasteText - the text that was pasted into this component from the clipboard

      • selectAll

        void selectAll()
        Called by the MenuManager when it registers a select all command from the user.

      • isHotkeyEnabled

        boolean isHotkeyEnabled()
        Even though a class may have the potential to use hotkeys, there is a layer of flexibility as to whether hotkeys will be operable for specific instances.
        Returns:
        whether the instance should allow the MenuManager to alter its contents by user hotkey input
